519.description_en: Each follows its Trainer’s orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.

520.name: Tranquill
520.description_en: It can return to its Trainer’s location regardless of the distance separating them.

521.name: Unfezant
521.description_en: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females’ flying abilities surpass those of the males.

522.name: Blitzle
522.description_en: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

523.name: Zebstrika
523.description_en: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

524.name: Roggenrola
524.description_en: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.

525.name: Boldore
525.description_en: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.

526.name: Gigalith
526.description_en: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.

527.name: Woobat
527.description_en: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

528.name: Swoobat
528.description_en: It emits sound waves of various frequencies from its nose, including some powerful enough to destroy rocks.

529.name: Drilbur
529.description_en: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.

530.name: Excadrill
530.description_en: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

531.name: Audino
531.description_en: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

532.name: Timburr
532.description_en: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle the lumber without difficulty.

533.name: Gurdurr
533.description_en: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

534.name: Conkeldurr
534.description_en: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.

535.name: Tympole
535.description_en: They warn others of danger by vibrating their cheeks to create a high-pitched sound.

536.name: Palpitoad
536.description_en: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.

537.name: Seismitoad
537.description_en: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

538.name: Throh
538.description_en: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.

539.name: Sawk
539.description_en: The sound of Sawk punching boulders and trees can be heard all the way from the mountains where they train.

540.name: Sewaddle
540.description_en: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. It hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.

541.name: Swadloon
541.description_en: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

542.name: Leavanny
542.description_en: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves, using the cutters on its arms and sticky silk.

543.name: Venipede
543.description_en: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

544.name: Whirlipede
544.description_en: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

545.name: Scolipede
545.description_en: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

546.name: Cottonee
546.description_en: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.

547.name: Whimsicott
547.description_en: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.

548.name: Petilil
548.description_en: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.

549.name: Lilligant
549.description_en: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.

550.name: Basculin-Red-Striped
550.description_en: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they’ll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.

551.name: Sandile
551.description_en: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.

552.name: Krokorok
552.description_en: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.

553.name: Krookodile
553.description_en: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.

554.name: Darumaka
554.description_en: When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. When the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.

555.name: Darmanitan-Standard
555.description_en: Its internal fire burns at 2,500° F, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

556.name: Maractus
556.description_en: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.

557.name: Dwebble
557.description_en: This Pokémon can easily melt holes in hard rocks with a liquid secreted from its mouth.

558.name: Crustle
558.description_en: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

559.name: Scraggy
559.description_en: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

560.name: Scrafty
560.description_en: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.

561.name: Sigilyph
561.description_en: They never vary the route they fly, because their memories of guarding an ancient city remain steadfast.

562.name: Yamask
562.description_en: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

563.name: Cofagrigus
563.description_en: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.

564.name: Tirtouga
564.description_en: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.

565.name: Carracosta
565.description_en: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.

566.name: Archen
566.description_en: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.

567.name: Archeops
567.description_en: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.

568.name: Trubbish
568.description_en: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.

569.name: Garbodor
569.description_en: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.

570.name: Zorua
570.description_en: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.

571.name: Zoroark
571.description_en: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

572.name: Minccino
572.description_en: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.

573.name: Cinccino
573.description_en: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.

574.name: Gothita
574.description_en: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

575.name: Gothorita
575.description_en: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.

576.name: Gothitelle
576.description_en: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

577.name: Solosis
577.description_en: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

578.name: Duosion
578.description_en: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.

579.name: Reuniclus
579.description_en: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

580.name: Ducklett
580.description_en: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food--peat moss.

581.name: Swanna
581.description_en: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

582.name: Vanillite
582.description_en: The temperature of their breath is -58° F. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.

583.name: Vanillish
583.description_en: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.

584.name: Vanilluxe
584.description_en: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and attack their foes with violent blizzards.

585.name: Deerling
585.description_en: The color and scent of their fur changes to match the mountain grass. When they sense hostility, they hide in the grass.

586.name: Sawsbuck
586.description_en: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck’s horns.

587.name: Emolga
587.description_en: The energy made in its cheeks’ electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.

588.name: Karrablast
588.description_en: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.

589.name: Escavalier
589.description_en: They fly around at high speed, striking with their pointed spears. Even when in trouble, they face opponents bravely.

590.name: Foongus
590.description_en: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.

591.name: Amoonguss
591.description_en: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.

592.name: Frillish
592.description_en: With its thin, veil-like arms wrapped around the body of its opponent, it sinks to the ocean floor.

593.name: Jellicent
593.description_en: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.

594.name: Alomomola
594.description_en: The special membrane enveloping Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.

595.name: Joltik
595.description_en: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.

596.name: Galvantula
596.description_en: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

597.name: Ferroseed
597.description_en: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.

598.name: Ferrothorn
598.description_en: It fights by swinging around its three spiky feelers. A hit from these steel spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.

599.name: Klink
599.description_en: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

600.name: Klang
600.description_en: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.

601.name: Klinklang
601.description_en: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.

602.name: Tynamo
602.description_en: While one alone doesn’t have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

603.name: Eelektrik
603.description_en: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.

604.name: Eelektross
604.description_en: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

605.name: Elgyem
605.description_en: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent’s brain, causing unendurable headaches.

606.name: Beheeyem
606.description_en: It can manipulate an opponent’s memory. Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three different-colored fingers.

607.name: Litwick
607.description_en: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

608.name: Lampent
608.description_en: This ominous Pokémon is feared. Through cities it wanders, searching for the spirits of the fallen.

609.name: Chandelure
609.description_en: It absorbs a spirit, which it then burns. By waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.

610.name: Axew
610.description_en: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.

611.name: Fraxure
611.description_en: Since a broken tusk will not grow back, they diligently sharpen their tusks on river rocks after they’ve been fighting.

612.name: Haxorus
612.description_en: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.

613.name: Cubchoo
613.description_en: When it is not feeling well, its mucus gets watery and the power of its Ice-type moves decreases.

614.name: Beartic
614.description_en: It can make its breath freeze at will. Very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.

615.name: Cryogonal
615.description_en: When its body temperature goes up, it turns into steam and vanishes. When its temperature lowers, it returns to ice.

616.name: Shelmet
616.description_en: When attacked, it defends itself by closing the lid of its shell. It can spit a sticky, poisonous liquid.

617.name: Accelgor
617.description_en: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

618.name: Stunfisk
618.description_en: Its skin is very hard, so it is unhurt even if stepped on by sumo wrestlers. It smiles when transmitting electricity.

619.name: Mienfoo
619.description_en: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.

620.name: Mienshao
620.description_en: It wields the fur on its arms like a whip. Its arm attacks come with such rapidity that they cannot even be seen.

621.name: Druddigon
621.description_en: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.

622.name: Golett
622.description_en: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.

623.name: Golurk
623.description_en: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

624.name: Pawniard
624.description_en: Blades comprise this Pokémon’s entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.

625.name: Bisharp
625.description_en: It leads a group of Pawniard. It battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.

626.name: Bouffalant
626.description_en: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

627.name: Rufflet
627.description_en: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.

628.name: Braviary
628.description_en: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.

629.name: Vullaby
629.description_en: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.

630.name: Mandibuzz
630.description_en: It makes a nest out of bones it finds. It grabs weakened prey in its talons and hauls it to its nest of bones.

631.name: Heatmor
631.description_en: It breathes through a hole in its tail while it burns with an internal fire. Durant is its prey.

632.name: Durant
632.description_en: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

633.name: Deino
633.description_en: It tends to bite everything, and it is not a picky eater. Approaching it carelessly is dangerous.

634.name: Zweilous
634.description_en: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

635.name: Hydreigon
635.description_en: This brutal Pokémon travels the skies on its six wings. Anything that moves seems like a foe to it, triggering its attack.

636.name: Larvesta
636.description_en: This Pokémon was believed to have been born from the sun. When it evolves, its entire body is engulfed in flames.

637.name: Volcarona
637.description_en: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona’s fire provided a replacement for the sun.

638.name: Cobalion
638.description_en: This legendary Pokémon battled against humans to protect Pokémon. Its personality is calm and composed.

639.name: Terrakion
639.description_en: This Pokémon came to the defense of Pokémon that had lost their homes in a war among humans.

640.name: Virizion
640.description_en: This Pokémon fought humans in order to protect its friends. Legends about it continue to be passed down.

641.name: Tornadus-Incarnate
641.description_en: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

642.name: Thundurus-Incarnate
642.description_en: Countless charred remains mar the landscape of places through which Thundurus has passed.

643.name: Reshiram
643.description_en: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

644.name: Zekrom
644.description_en: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

645.name: Landorus-Incarnate
645.description_en: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as “The Guardian of the Fields.”

646.name: Kyurem
646.description_en: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

647.name: Keldeo-Ordinary
647.description_en: By blasting water from its hooves, it can glide across water. It excels at using leg moves while battling.

648.name: Meloetta-Aria
648.description_en: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

649.name: Genesect
649.description_en: Over 300 million years ago, it was feared as the strongest of hunters. It has been modified by Team Plasma.

650.name: Chespin
650.description_en: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

651.name: Quilladin
651.description_en: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.

652.name: Chesnaught
652.description_en: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.

653.name: Fennekin
653.description_en: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.

654.name: Braixen
654.description_en: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.

655.name: Delphox
655.description_en: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.

656.name: Froakie
656.description_en: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

657.name: Frogadier
657.description_en: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

658.name: Greninja
658.description_en: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

659.name: Bunnelby
659.description_en: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.

660.name: Diggersby
660.description_en: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.

661.name: Fletchling
661.description_en: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.

662.name: Fletchinder
662.description_en: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.

663.name: Talonflame
663.description_en: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.

664.name: Scatterbug
664.description_en: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.

665.name: Spewpa
665.description_en: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.

666.name: Vivillon
666.description_en: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.

667.name: Litleo
667.description_en: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

668.name: Pyroar
668.description_en: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.

669.name: Flabebe
669.description_en: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.

670.name: Floette
670.description_en: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.

671.name: Florges
671.description_en: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.

672.name: Skiddo
672.description_en: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

673.name: Gogoat
673.description_en: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.

674.name: Pancham
674.description_en: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.

675.name: Pangoro
675.description_en: Although it possesses a violent temperament, it won’t put up with bullying. It uses the leaf in its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.

676.name: Furfrou
676.description_en: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.

677.name: Espurr
677.description_en: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.

678.name: Meowstic-Male
678.description_en: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.

679.name: Honedge
679.description_en: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.

680.name: Doublade
680.description_en: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.

681.name: Aegislash-Shield
681.description_en: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.

682.name: Spritzee
682.description_en: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.

683.name: Aromatisse
683.description_en: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.

684.name: Swirlix
684.description_en: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.

685.name: Slurpuff
685.description_en: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.

686.name: Inkay
686.description_en: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.

687.name: Malamar
687.description_en: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.

688.name: Binacle
688.description_en: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.

689.name: Barbaracle
689.description_en: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.

690.name: Skrelp
690.description_en: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.

691.name: Dragalge
691.description_en: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.

692.name: Clauncher
692.description_en: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.

693.name: Clawitzer
693.description_en: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.

694.name: Helioptile
694.description_en: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

695.name: Heliolisk
695.description_en: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

696.name: Tyrunt
696.description_en: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn’t like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.

697.name: Tyrantrum
697.description_en: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.

698.name: Amaura
698.description_en: This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.

699.name: Aurorus
699.description_en: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.

700.name: Sylveon
700.description_en: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.

701.name: Hawlucha
701.description_en: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.

702.name: Dedenne
702.description_en: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.

703.name: Carbink
703.description_en: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.

704.name: Goomy
704.description_en: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn’t dry out.

705.name: Sliggoo
705.description_en: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can’t see anything.

706.name: Goodra
706.description_en: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.

707.name: Klefki
707.description_en: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.

708.name: Phantump
708.description_en: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.

709.name: Trevenant
709.description_en: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.

710.name: Pumpkaboo-Average
710.description_en: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

711.name: Gourgeist-Average
711.description_en: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.

712.name: Bergmite
712.description_en: It blocks opponents’ attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.

713.name: Avalugg
713.description_en: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.

714.name: Noibat
714.description_en: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.

715.name: Noivern
715.description_en: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.

716.name: Xerneas
716.description_en: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.

717.name: Yveltal
717.description_en: When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.

718.name: Zygarde-50
718.description_en: When the Kalos region’s ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.

719.name: Diancie
719.description_en: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

720.name: Hoopa
720.description_en: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.

721.name: Volcanion
721.description_en: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.

722.name: Rowlet
722.description_en: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.

723.name: Dartrix
723.description_en: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.

724.name: Decidueye
724.description_en: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.

725.name: Litten
725.description_en: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.

726.name: Torracat
726.description_en: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokémon spits fire.

727.name: Incineroar
727.description_en: This Pokémon has a violent, selfish disposition. If it’s not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainer’s orders with complete nonchalance.

728.name: Popplio
728.description_en: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It’s famous for being a hard worker.

729.name: Brionne
729.description_en: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, and briskly bombards its enemies.

730.name: Primarina
730.description_en: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.

731.name: Pikipek
731.description_en: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.

732.name: Trumbeak
732.description_en: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.

733.name: Toucannon
733.description_en: When it battles, its beak heats up. The temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.

734.name: Yungoos
734.description_en: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.

735.name: Gumshoos
735.description_en: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but it’s always snoozing by nightfall.

736.name: Grubbin
736.description_en: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.

737.name: Charjabug
737.description_en: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.

738.name: Vikavolt
738.description_en: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.

739.name: Crabrawler
739.description_en: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.

740.name: Crabominable
740.description_en: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokémon evolved and grew fur.

741.name: Oricorio-Baile
741.description_en: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.

742.name: Cutiefly
742.description_en: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because it’s able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.

743.name: Ribombee
743.description_en: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.

744.name: Rockruff
744.description_en: It’s considered to be a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.

745.name: Lycanroc-Midday
745.description_en: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.

746.name: Wishiwashi-Solo
746.description_en: When it’s in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.

747.name: Mareanie
747.description_en: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.

748.name: Toxapex
748.description_en: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.

749.name: Mudbray
749.description_en: The mud stuck to Mudbray’s hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.

750.name: Mudsdale
750.description_en: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.

751.name: Dewpider
751.description_en: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.

752.name: Araquanid
752.description_en: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.

753.name: Fomantis
753.description_en: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.

754.name: Lurantis
754.description_en: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantis’s vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.

755.name: Morelull
755.description_en: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.

756.name: Shiinotic
756.description_en: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.

757.name: Salandit
757.description_en: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.

758.name: Salazzle
758.description_en: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.

759.name: Stufful
759.description_en: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.

760.name: Bewear
760.description_en: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.

761.name: Bounsweet
761.description_en: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.

762.name: Steenee
762.description_en: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokémon, this Pokémon is totally fine.

763.name: Tsareena
763.description_en: Its long, striking legs aren’t just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.

764.name: Comfey
764.description_en: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.

765.name: Oranguru
765.description_en: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokémon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so it’s best suited to veteran Trainers.

766.name: Passimian
766.description_en: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkable—they will never let down a comrade.

767.name: Wimpod
767.description_en: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.

768.name: Golisopod
768.description_en: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater—or even air—right in two.

769.name: Sandygast
769.description_en: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokémon embodies the grudges of the departed.

770.name: Palossand
770.description_en: Possessed people controlled by this Pokémon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.

771.name: Pyukumuku
771.description_en: It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.

772.name: Type-Null
772.description_en: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokémon has some hidden special power.

773.name: Silvally
773.description_en: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokémon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.

774.name: Minior-Red-Meteor
774.description_en: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.

775.name: Komala
775.description_en: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.

776.name: Turtonator
776.description_en: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.

777.name: Togedemaru
777.description_en: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokémon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.

778.name: Mimikyu-Disguised
778.description_en: Its actual appearance is unknown. A scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by terror and died from the shock.

779.name: Bruxish
779.description_en: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.

780.name: Drampa
780.description_en: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.

781.name: Dhelmise
781.description_en: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.

782.name: Jangmo-O
782.description_en: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.

783.name: Hakamo-O
783.description_en: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.

784.name: Kommo-O
784.description_en: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.

785.name: Tapu-Koko
785.description_en: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.

786.name: Tapu-Lele
786.description_en: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.

787.name: Tapu-Bulu
787.description_en: It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around. It causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth.

788.name: Tapu-Fini
788.description_en: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.

789.name: Cosmog
789.description_en: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.

790.name: Cosmoem
790.description_en: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.

791.name: Solgaleo
791.description_en: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.

792.name: Lunala
792.description_en: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.

793.name: Nihilego
793.description_en: One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.

794.name: Buzzwole
794.description_en: This Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.

795.name: Pheromosa
795.description_en: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.

796.name: Xurkitree
796.description_en: One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.

797.name: Celesteela
797.description_en: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.

798.name: Kartana
798.description_en: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.

799.name: Guzzlord
799.description_en: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. It’s one of the Ultra Beasts.

800.name: Necrozma
800.description_en: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.

801.name: Magearna
801.description_en: This artificial Pokémon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.

802.name: Marshadow
802.description_en: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.

803.name: Poipole
803.description_en: This Ultra Beast is well enough liked to be chosen as a first partner in its own world.

804.name: Naganadel
804.description_en: It stores hundreds of liters of poisonous liquid inside its body. It is one of the organisms known as UBs.

805.name: Stakataka
805.description_en: It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.

806.name: Blacephalon
806.description_en: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It’s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

807.name: Zeraora
807.description_en: It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they’ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.

808.name: Meltan
808.description_en: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

809.name: Melmetal
809.description_en: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.

810.name: Grookey
810.description_en: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

811.name: Thwackey
811.description_en: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.

812.name: Rillaboom
812.description_en: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

813.name: Scorbunny
813.description_en: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon’s body. Once that happens, it’s ready to fight at full power.

814.name: Raboot
814.description_en: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.

815.name: Cinderace
815.description_en: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.

816.name: Sobble
816.description_en: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won’t be able to resist weeping.

817.name: Drizzile
817.description_en: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.

818.name: Inteleon
818.description_en: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.

819.name: Skwovet
819.description_en: Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon becomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely empty of berries.

820.name: Greedent
820.description_en: It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that they fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit slow-witted, so it doesn’t notice the loss.

821.name: Rookidee
821.description_en: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.

822.name: Corvisquire
822.description_en: Smart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.

823.name: Corviknight
823.description_en: This Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.

824.name: Blipbug
824.description_en: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.

825.name: Dottler
825.description_en: It barely moves, but it’s still alive. Hiding in its shell without food or water seems to have awakened its psychic powers.

826.name: Orbeetle
826.description_en: It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and the large size of its brain is proof that it also possesses immense psychic power.

827.name: Nickit
827.description_en: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.

828.name: Thievul
828.description_en: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

829.name: Gossifleur
829.description_en: It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg, then basks in the sun. After absorbing enough sunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.

830.name: Eldegoss
830.description_en: The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of nutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that plants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.

831.name: Wooloo
831.description_en: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.

832.name: Dubwool
832.description_en: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.

833.name: Chewtle
833.description_en: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.

834.name: Drednaw
834.description_en: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.

835.name: Yamper
835.description_en: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.

836.name: Boltund
836.description_en: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.

837.name: Rolycoly
837.description_en: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.

838.name: Carkol
838.description_en: It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by this Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of people in the Galar region.

839.name: Coalossal
839.description_en: It’s usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

840.name: Applin
840.description_en: It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides from its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by pretending it’s just an apple and nothing more.

841.name: Flapple
841.description_en: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.

842.name: Appletun
842.description_en: Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution. A nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in the bug Pokémon it preys on.

843.name: Silicobra
843.description_en: As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.

844.name: Sandaconda
844.description_en: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.

845.name: Cramorant
845.description_en: It’s so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it’s battling midfight.

846.name: Arrokuda
846.description_en: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It’s very proud of that jaw.

847.name: Barraskewda
847.description_en: This Pokémon has a jaw that’s as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda’s flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.

848.name: Toxel
848.description_en: It stores poison in an internal poison sac and secretes that poison through its skin. If you touch this Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.

849.name: Toxtricity-Amped
849.description_en: When this Pokémon sounds as if it’s strumming a guitar, it’s actually clawing at the protrusions on its chest to generate electricity.

850.name: Sizzlipede
850.description_en: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

851.name: Centiskorch
851.description_en: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

852.name: Clobbopus
852.description_en: It’s very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

853.name: Grapploct
853.description_en: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.

854.name: Sinistea
854.description_en: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.

855.name: Polteageist
855.description_en: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.

856.name: Hatenna
856.description_en: Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other creatures’ emotions. If you don’t have a calm disposition, it will never warm up to you.

857.name: Hattrem
857.description_en: No matter who you are, if you bring strong emotions near this Pokémon, it will silence you violently.

858.name: Hatterene
858.description_en: It emits psychic power strong enough to cause headaches as a deterrent to the approach of others.

859.name: Impidimp
859.description_en: Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations produced by people and Pokémon when they feel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.

860.name: Morgrem
860.description_en: When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for forgiveness, it’s trying to lure opponents in so that it can stab them with its spear-like hair.

861.name: Grimmsnarl
861.description_en: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm even Machamp.

862.name: Obstagoon
862.description_en: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.

863.name: Perrserker
863.description_en: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

864.name: Cursola
864.description_en: Its shell is overflowing with its heightened otherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as protection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.

865.name: Sirfetchd
865.description_en: Only Farfetch’d that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon’s leek withers, it will retire from combat.

866.name: Mr-Rime
866.description_en: It’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.

867.name: Runerigus
867.description_en: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.

868.name: Milcery
868.description_en: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.

869.name: Alcremie
869.description_en: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it’s decorated with cream.

870.name: Falinks
870.description_en: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass’s orders are absolute.

871.name: Pincurchin
871.description_en: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.

872.name: Snom
872.description_en: It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of energy and uses it to tie its body to branches, disguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.

873.name: Frosmoth
873.description_en: Icy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies over fields and mountains. The temperature of its wings is less than −290 degrees Fahrenheit.

874.name: Stonjourner
874.description_en: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun’s descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.

875.name: Eiscue-Ice
875.description_en: It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a frigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to make sure it stays nice and cold.

876.name: Indeedee-Male
876.description_en: It uses the horns on its head to sense the emotions of others. Males will act as valets for those they serve, looking after their every need.

877.name: Morpeko-Full-Belly
877.description_en: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It’s also generating electricity.

878.name: Cufant
878.description_en: It digs up the ground with its trunk. It’s also very strong, being able to carry loads of over five tons without any problem at all.

879.name: Copperajah
879.description_en: They came over from another region long ago and worked together with humans. Their green skin is resistant to water.

880.name: Dracozolt
880.description_en: In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its powerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway after it depleted all its plant-based food sources.

881.name: Arctozolt
881.description_en: The shaking of its freezing upper half is what generates its electricity. It has a hard time walking around.

882.name: Dracovish
882.description_en: Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator of its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was what drove it to extinction.

883.name: Arctovish
883.description_en: Though it’s able to capture prey by freezing its surroundings, it has trouble eating the prey afterward because its mouth is on top of its head.

884.name: Duraludon
884.description_en: Its body resembles polished metal, and it’s both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.

885.name: Dreepy
885.description_en: After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon, Dreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit back when it was alive in prehistoric seas.

886.name: Drakloak
886.description_en: It’s capable of flying faster than 120 mph. It battles alongside Dreepy and dotes on them until they successfully evolve.

887.name: Dragapult
887.description_en: When it isn’t battling, it keeps Dreepy in the holes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches the Dreepy like supersonic missiles.

888.name: Zacian
888.description_en: Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon absorbs metal particles, transforming them into a weapon it uses to battle.

889.name: Zamazenta
889.description_en: In times past, it worked together with a king of the people to save the Galar region. It absorbs metal that it then uses in battle.

890.name: Eternatus
890.description_en: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.

891.name: Kubfu
891.description_en: Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves it masters will determine which form it takes when it evolves.

892.name: Urshifu-Single-Strike
892.description_en: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the one-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes and land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.

893.name: Zarude
893.description_en: Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It’s incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.

894.name: Regieleki
894.description_en: This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy. It’s said that removing the rings on Regieleki’s body will unleash the Pokémon’s latent power.

895.name: Regidrago
895.description_en: An academic theory proposes that Regidrago’s arms were once the head of an ancient dragon Pokémon. The theory remains unproven.

896.name: Glastrier
896.description_en: Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves. It’s also a belligerent Pokémon—anything it wants, it takes by force.

897.name: Spectrier
897.description_en: It probes its surroundings with all its senses save one—it doesn’t use its sense of sight. Spectrier’s kicks are said to separate soul from body.

898.name: Calyrex
898.description_en: Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. It reigned over the Galar region in times of yore.

899.name: Wyrdeer
899.description_en: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.

900.name: Kleavor
900.description_en: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.

901.name: Ursaluna
901.description_en: I believe it was Hisui's swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.

902.name: Basculegion-Male
902.description_en: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui's rivers is Basculegion's equal.

903.name: Sneasler
903.description_en: Because of Sneasler's virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.

904.name: Overqwil
904.description_en: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname ”sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.

905.name: Enamorus-Incarnate
905.description_en: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.

906.name: Sprigatito
906.description_en: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.

907.name: Floragato
907.description_en: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.

908.name: Meowscarada
908.description_en: This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.

909.name: Fuecoco
909.description_en: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.

910.name: Crocalor
910.description_en: The combination of Crocalor’s fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon’s head.

911.name: Skeledirge
911.description_en: The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirge’s head gained a soul.

912.name: Quaxly
912.description_en: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime."

913.name: Quaxwell
913.description_en: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.

914.name: Quaquaval
914.description_en: A single kick from a Quaquaval can send a truck rolling. This Pokémon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.

915.name: Lechonk
915.description_en: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn’t use it for anything other than foraging.

916.name: Oinkologne-Male
916.description_en: Oinkologne is proud of its fine, glossy skin. It emits a concentrated scent from the tip of its tail.

917.name: Tarountula
917.description_en: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon’s natural enemy.

918.name: Spidops
918.description_en: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.

919.name: Nymble
919.description_en: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it’s in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.

920.name: Lokix
920.description_en: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.

921.name: Pawmi
921.description_en: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.

922.name: Pawmo
922.description_en: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.

923.name: Pawmot
923.description_en: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.

924.name: Tandemaus
924.description_en: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.

925.name: Maushold-Family-Of-Four
925.description_en: The two little ones just appeared one day. The group might be a family of related Pokémon, but nobody knows for sure.

926.name: Fidough
926.description_en: This Pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough’s breath induces fermentation in the Pokémon’s vicinity.

927.name: Dachsbun
927.description_en: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon’s body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.

928.name: Smoliv
928.description_en: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.

929.name: Dolliv
929.description_en: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.

930.name: Arboliva
930.description_en: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.

931.name: Squawkabilly-Green-Plumage
931.description_en: These Pokémon prefer to live in cities. They form flocks based on the color of their feathers, and they fight over territory.

932.name: Nacli
932.description_en: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.

933.name: Naclstack
933.description_en: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey’s body.

934.name: Garganacl
934.description_en: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.

935.name: Charcadet
935.description_en: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.

936.name: Armarouge
936.description_en: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.

937.name: Ceruledge
937.description_en: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.

938.name: Tadbulb
938.description_en: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.

939.name: Bellibolt
939.description_en: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.

940.name: Wattrel
940.description_en: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.

941.name: Kilowattrel
941.description_en: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.

942.name: Maschiff
942.description_en: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff’s face.

943.name: Mabosstiff
943.description_en: This Pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.

944.name: Shroodle
944.description_en: Though usually a mellow Pokémon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.

945.name: Grafaiai
945.description_en: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokémon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.

946.name: Bramblin
946.description_en: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.

947.name: Brambleghast
947.description_en: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.

948.name: Toedscool
948.description_en: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.

949.name: Toedscruel
949.description_en: These Pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.

950.name: Klawf
950.description_en: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can’t remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.

951.name: Capsakid
951.description_en: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.

952.name: Scovillain
952.description_en: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.

953.name: Rellor
953.description_en: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.

954.name: Rabsca
954.description_en: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.

955.name: Flittle
955.description_en: Flittle’s toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon’s belly.

956.name: Espathra
956.description_en: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.

957.name: Tinkatink
957.description_en: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.

958.name: Tinkatuff
958.description_en: This Pokémon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.

959.name: Tinkaton
959.description_en: This intelligent Pokémon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.

960.name: Wiglett
960.description_en: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.

961.name: Wugtrio
961.description_en: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.

962.name: Bombirdier
962.description_en: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémon’s chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.

963.name: Finizen
963.description_en: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.

964.name: Palafin-Zero
964.description_en: This Pokémon changes its appearance if it hears its allies calling for help. Palafin will never show anybody its moment of transformation.

965.name: Varoom
965.description_en: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.

966.name: Revavroom
966.description_en: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders—now numbering eight—to generate energy.

967.name: Cyclizar
967.description_en: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.

968.name: Orthworm
968.description_en: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.

969.name: Glimmet
969.description_en: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.

970.name: Glimmora
970.description_en: When this Pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.

971.name: Greavard
971.description_en: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.

972.name: Houndstone
972.description_en: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.

973.name: Flamigo
973.description_en: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.

974.name: Cetoddle
974.description_en: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.

975.name: Cetitan
975.description_en: This Pokémon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.

976.name: Veluza
976.description_en: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.

977.name: Dondozo
977.description_en: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it’s bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.

978.name: Tatsugiri-Curly
978.description_en: This is a small dragon Pokémon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.

979.name: Annihilape
979.description_en: When its anger rose beyond a critical point, this Pokémon gained power that is unfettered by the limits of its physical body.

980.name: Clodsire
980.description_en: When attacked, this Pokémon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. It’s a risky move that puts everything on the line.

981.name: Farigiraf
981.description_en: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig’s.

982.name: Dudunsparce-Two-Segment
982.description_en: This Pokémon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.

983.name: Kingambit
983.description_en: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.

984.name: Great-Tusk
984.description_en: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.

985.name: Scream-Tail
985.description_en: There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.

986.name: Brute-Bonnet
986.description_en: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.

987.name: Flutter-Mane
987.description_en: This Pokémon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.

988.name: Slither-Wing
988.description_en: This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.

989.name: Sandy-Shocks
989.description_en: No records exist of this Pokémon being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon’s traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal.

990.name: Iron-Treads
990.description_en: This Pokémon closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.

991.name: Iron-Bundle
991.description_en: Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.

992.name: Iron-Hands
992.description_en: It is very similar to a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.

993.name: Iron-Jugulis
993.description_en: It resembles a certain Pokémon introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.

994.name: Iron-Moth
994.description_en: This Pokémon resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.

995.name: Iron-Thorns
995.description_en: It has some similarities to a Pokémon introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.

996.name: Frigibax
996.description_en: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.

997.name: Arctibax
997.description_en: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.

998.name: Baxcalibur
998.description_en: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.

999.name: Gimmighoul
999.description_en: This Pokémon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.

1000.name: Gholdengo
1000.description_en: Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokémon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.

1001.name: Wo-Chien
1001.description_en: The grudge of a person punished for writing the king’s evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokémon.

1002.name: Chien-Pao
1002.description_en: This Pokémon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.

1003.name: Ting-Lu
1003.description_en: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémon.

1004.name: Chi-Yu
1004.description_en: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.

1005.name: Roaring-Moon
1005.description_en: It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.

1006.name: Iron-Valiant
1006.description_en: It has some similarities to a mad scientist’s invention covered in a paranormal magazine.

1007.name: Koraidon
1007.description_en: This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.

1008.name: Miraidon
1008.description_en: Much remains unknown about this creature. It resembles Cyclizar, but it is far more ruthless and powerful.

1009.name: Walking-Wake
1009.description_en: This ferocious creature is shrouded in mystery. It's named after an aquatic monster mentioned in an old expedition journal.

1010.name: Iron-Leaves
1010.description_en: Many of its physical characteristics match those of a Virizion from the future that was covered in a paranormal magazine.

1011.name: Dipplin
1011.description_en: Dipplin is two creatures in one Pokémon. Its evolution was triggered by a special apple grown only in one place.

1012.name: Poltchageist
1012.description_en: Supposedly, the regrets of a tea ceremony master who died before perfecting his craft lingered in some matcha and became a Pokémon.

1013.name: Sinistcha
1013.description_en: It pretends to be tea, trying to fool people into drinking it so it can drain their life-force. Its ruse is generally unsuccessful.

1014.name: Okidogi
1014.description_en: After all its muscles were stimulated by the toxic chain around its neck, Okidogi transformed and gained a powerful physique.

1015.name: Munkidori
1015.description_en: The chain is made from toxins that enhance capabilities. It stimulated Munkidori's brain and caused the Pokémon's psychic powers to bloom.

1016.name: Fezandipiti
1016.description_en: Fezandipiti owes its beautiful looks and lovely voice to the toxic stimulants emanating from the chain wrapped around its body.

1017.name: Ogerpon
1017.description_en: This Pokémon's type changes based on which mask it's wearing. It confounds its enemies with nimble movements and kicks.

1018.name: Archaludon
1018.description_en: It gathers static electricity from its surroundings. The beams it launches when down on all fours are tremendously powerful.

1019.name: Hydrapple
1019.description_en: Seven syrpents live inside an apple made of syrup. The syrpent in the center is the commander.

1020.name: Gouging-Fire
1020.description_en: There are scant few reports of this creature being sighted. One short video shows it rampaging and spouting pillars of flame.

1021.name: Raging-Bolt
1021.description_en: It's said to incinerate everything around it with lightning launched from its fur. Very little is known about this creature.

1022.name: Iron-Boulder
1022.description_en: It resembles a Pokémon described in a dubious magazine as a Terrakion that had been modified by an evil organization.

1023.name: Iron-Crown
1023.description_en: It resembles a mysterious object introduced in a paranormal magazine as a cutting-edge weapon shaped like a Cobalion.

1024.name: Terapagos
1024.description_en: Terapagos protects itself using its power to transform energy into hard crystals. This Pokémon is the source of the Terastal phenomenon.

1025.name: Pecharunt
1025.description_en: It feeds others toxic mochi that draw out desires and capabilities. Those who eat the mochi fall under Pecharunt’s control, chained to its will.
